title: E field - sphere of mass m charge q on the Moon

content.question: A small insulating sphere of mass <math alttext="m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and charge <math alttext="positive q" overflow="scroll"><mpadded><mo>+</mo><mi>q</mi></mpadded></math> hangs from a string with negligible mass near the surface of Earth, as shown in the figure. A uniform electric field is directed horizontally, causing the sphere to hang with the string at an angle <math alttext="theta" overflow="scroll"><mi>Î¸</mi></math> from the vertical. Suppose that a different sphere hangs from a string on the surface of the Moon, where the acceleration due to gravity is approximately <math alttext="one sixth" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>6</mn></mfrac></math> times that of Earth. Which of the following modifications could be made so that the sphere and string hang at the same angle on the Moon as on Earth?

choices.label: Increase the mass by a factor of <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> and decrease the charge by a factor of <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
Decrease the mass by a factor of <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> and increase the charge by a factor of <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
Increase the charge by a factor of <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> and decrease the electric field by a factor of <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
Decrease the charge by a factor of <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> and increase the electric field by a factor of <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.

content.answer: Increase the mass by a factor of <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> and decrease the charge by a factor of <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>.
